results.question: What method did the company use when Topic 606 in fiscal 2019 was adopted?

results.question: What caused the increase in capital expenditures related to wireless?
gold_answer: result of investments made to upgrade our wireless network to continue delivering reliable performance for our customers.
results.markdown_table_response: Wireless is a rapidly expanding market. Wireless accounted for $1.2 billion in capital expenditures in 2019. results.question: What caused the decrease in capital expenditure in cable in 2019?
gold_answer: result of lower purchases of customer premise equipment and lower investments related to the initial launch of Ignite TV.
results.markdown_table_response: The decrease in capital expenditure in cable this year was a result of lower purchases of customer premise equipment and lower investments related to the initial launch of Ignite TV. We have continued upgrading our network infrastructure with additional fibre deployments, including increasing our fibre-to-the-home and fibre-to-the-curb distribution. These upgrades will lower the number of homes passed per node and incorporate the latest technologies to help deliver more bandwidth and an even more reliable customer experience as we progress in our Connected Home roadmap.
results.csv_string_response:
"A: In 2019, we had to cut costs for new equipment and equipment upgrades and set back our existing equipment with the purchase of spectrum licences to ensure that our network was up to speed. In addition, we had to increase our fibre-to-the-home and fibre-to-the-curb distribution capacity. The latter was achieved through a combination of acquisition of additional equipment and investments in our existing broadcast and IT infrastructure. In addition, we had to reduce our telecommunications business and reduce our capacity for marketing our products to new customers. We also had to increase the size of our business and reorganize our business structure.
B: The main cause of the decrease in capital expenditure in Cable this year was the decline in our wireless network, which led to an increase in capital expenditure. We also had to lower our broadband prices. We also had to increase our media and communications business and reduce our capacity for marketing our products to new customers."

results.question: How is the fair value of financial instruments that are not traded in active markets determined?
results.markdown_table_response:
The fair value of financial instruments that are not traded in active markets is determined with reference to quoted market prices at the end of the reporting period. A market is regarded as active if quoted prices are readily and regularly available from an exchange, dealer, broker, industry group, pricing service, or regulatory agency, and those prices represent actual and regularly occurring market transactions on an arm’s length basis. These instruments are included in level 1.

results.csv_string_response: The company used Adjusted EBITDA to provide an alternative comparison of its operating results to that of our other GAAP measures and to provide an alternative measure of our operating results compared to that of our other GAAP measures. These measures were calculated using our executive bonus plan, which was set forth in the Operating Plan and which provides for the payment of the executive bonus in accordance with GAAP. The executive bonus plan is based on the amount of compensation that each executive receives in the event of his or her being terminated. In accordance with GAAP, compensation amounts are discounted to a year at the rate of 5% of the amount of compensation received. The discount rate was based on the fact that compensation received in the year prior to the year in which the executive bonus was set would be paid at the same rate as compensation received in the year prior to the year in which the executive bonus was set.

results.question: What are the respective goodwill at 2018 and 2019?
results.markdown_table_response: Goodwill represents the total amount of cash realized on the sale of a business. Goodwill is calculated in the following manner. First, the value of all assets and liabilities incurred by the business (including goodwill) is determined. Next, the goodwill is divided by the value of all assets and liabilities acquired by the business and divided by the value of all assets and liabilities assumed at the time of the acquisition. Goodwill is then adjusted to reflect the valuation of the assets and liabilities assumed at the time of the acquisition. Finally, the value of goodwill is calculated as the average of goodwill at the time of acquisition and the average of the valuation of all assets and liabilities acquired by the business and assumed at the time of the acquisition.

results.question: How much did net sales change between 2017 and 2018?
results.markdown_table_response: Net sales increased $19.7 million or 10.8% from $182.2 million in fiscal year 2017. The increase in net sales was primarily driven by an increase in net sales in the distributor channel across all the APAC and EMEA regions of $13.7 million, a $3.3 million increase in net sales in the OEM channel of the EMEA region and a $4.2 million increase in the EMS channel across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC regions. These increases were partially offset by a decrease in net sales of $1.2 million in the OEM channel across the Americas, APAC, and JPKO regions. In addition, there was a favorable impact of $7.6 million from foreign currency exchange primarily due to the change in the value of the Euro compared to the U.S. dollar.
